skill.name: biopython
skill.description: Primary Python toolkit for molecular biology. Preferred for Python-based PubMed/NCBI queries (Bio.Entrez), sequence manipulation, file parsing (FASTA, GenBank, FASTQ, PDB), advanced BLAST workflows, structures, phylogenetics. For quick BLAST, use gget. For direct REST API, use pubmed-database.
skill.summary: Primary Python toolkit for molecular biology. Preferred for Python-based PubMed/NCBI queries (Bio.En...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill content is documentation and example code. Examples show network access and external tool commands, but require explicit user execution. No hidden execution, obfuscation, or data exfiltration patterns were found.

content.user_title: Analyze molecular biology data with Biopython
content.value_statement: Bioinformatics tasks are slow without clear modules and examples. This skill provides focused Biopython workflows for sequences, databases, alignments, and structures.
actual_capabilities: Parse and write FASTA, GenBank, and FASTQ files with SeqIO
Run Entrez searches and fetch records from NCBI databases
Execute and parse BLAST searches and XML results
Perform pairwise and multiple sequence alignments with Bio.Align and AlignIO
Parse PDB and mmCIF structures and compute distances or RMSD
Build and manipulate phylogenetic trees from alignments
limitations: Requires Python 3 and Biopython to run code examples
Some workflows need external tools such as DSSP or local BLAST
NCBI access requires an email and follows rate limits
Does not supply datasets or validate scientific conclusions

use_cases.title: Convert and filter sequences
use_cases.description: Parse large FASTA or GenBank files, filter records, and export clean subsets.

use_cases.title: Query NCBI for papers
use_cases.description: Search PubMed or GenBank with Entrez and fetch records for a project.

use_cases.title: Inspect protein structures
use_cases.description: Load PDB files, measure distances, and extract chain sequences.

prompt_templates.title: Read a FASTA
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to read a FASTA file with SeqIO and print each record id and length.

prompt_templates.title: Search PubMed
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a Biopython example to search PubMed for CRISPR and list the first five PMIDs.

prompt_templates.title: Run BLASTN
prompt_templates.prompt: Give steps to run a BLASTN query and list top hit titles with E values.

prompt_templates.title: Build a tree
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a pipeline to read an aligned FASTA, compute distances, and build a neighbor joining tree.

output_examples.input: Summarize the steps to fetch a GenBank record by accession.
output: Set Entrez email for NCBI access
Use Entrez.efetch with the accession and rettype genbank
Read the record with SeqIO and close the handle

best_practices: Set Entrez.email and respect NCBI rate limits
Use iterators for large sequence files to reduce memory use
Validate file formats before parsing or converting
anti_patterns: Running BLAST without throttling or caching results
Parsing large files by loading all records into memory
Skipping error handling for network or file operations

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides Biopython guidance that works across Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not execute code or provide datasets. You must run examples in your environment.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with local BLAST or DSSP?
faq.answer: Yes, examples show how to call external tools when installed locally.

faq.question: Does it send data off my machine?
faq.answer: Only if you run Entrez or BLAST examples. The documentation itself does not transmit data.

faq.question: What should I do if Entrez returns HTTP errors?
faq.answer: Check accessions, set Entrez.email, and slow requests to meet NCBI limits.

faq.question: How does it compare to direct REST API use?
faq.answer: It focuses on Biopython workflows. Direct REST calls are better for custom endpoints.
